item.title: Blank Verse 19-Mar-2014
item.description: Blank Verse is a webseries about William Shakespeare and the great writers of his time, re-imagined as modern day university students. Featuring famous names like Chris Marlowe, Ben Jonson and Thomas Kyd, the series takes the historical events and context in which Shakespeare produced his famous works and throws them into the contemporary world.
item.itunes:subtitle: Shakespeare & the writers of his time re-imagined as modern day university students

item.title: The Arts Report 04-Jul-2012
item.description:
This week on the Arts Report, I review and discuss morko by Cindy Mochizuki & Emma Hendrik and directed by James Long, audio from which will be in Spatial Poetics XI from the Powell Street Festival.
Plus interviews with Geoff Berner and Veda Hille who will be performing at the Vancouver Folk Fest, and James Bates interviews Mike Bernard, co-director of Coast Modern, a film about modern Pacific Northwest architecture which was a major DOXA film success.
item.itunes:subtitle: morko & Spatial Poetics XI (audio & animation), Geoff Berner and Veda Hille (Vancouver Folk Fest) and Coast Modern (modern architecture & DOXA film success!)

Plus, Christina Chant is in studio to talk about the third in a series of DIY, no talent necessary, pop art shows - this time it's the Spice Girls at the Fall Gallery.
